oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Model 1842 percussion musket relic
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: Dug near Woodbury, probably from a January 23, 1863 skirmish involving Kentucky cavalry units with Confederate Gen. John Hunt Morgan and Union artillery. The Federal Parrott artillery pieces, according to the Official Records, were trying to dislodge Morgan's dismounted men behind a double stone wall. This was the last smoothbore musket and first percussion piece produced by Federal arsenals.
